instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
I have a 2012 11" MacBook Air board that is giving the fan spin, no chime, 1 beep every 5 seconds goodness.

What would you recommend I check or do? Is that a matter of the machine not seeing the ram? Or a bad ram module?

It had some liquid contact, but not a lot and I do not believe any seemed to be close to the ram modules...

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Corrosion under somewhere. Could be anything, SMC/CPU/RAM

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: So many other machines, this was on the bottom of the pile. I will take it out and inspect every inch of the board again. i'll report back...

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Diode check the SMBUS on <RESISTOR>R5200</RESISTOR>/01. Check all devices connected to it for corrosion.

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message:
So all seems to check out on SMBUS @ <RESISTOR>R5200</RESISTOR>/01. 

I did find some very red, weak, traces by <CHIP>U7300</CHIP>. Fixed them and still have the issue... Could <CHIP>U7300</CHIP> cause this issue? It does have to do with the ram it seems...

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3</SIGNAL> is measuring at 1.34V, is that close enough to 1.5v? Or do you think that could be part of the issue?

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: for the diode measurements on <RESISTOR>R5200</RESISTOR>/5201 I was getting 0.4xx on both lines. BTW

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: 1.35V is for DDRL RAM which is OK. I have no ideas about this one, too many possibilities. Corrosion somewhere, start fluxing and reflowing stuff and pray.

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Wish I had (could afford) a Crest cleaner from Louis, would probably fix it for me.

threads.title: 2012 11" i7 board 1 beep <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B
threads.message: Well, I might as well have some fun fluxing and reflowing! Like you said on another board of mine, "It is no good like it is!" so I can't do much worse to it. If anything I'll have a spare board for parts LOL
